text: Maria Piątkowska (née Ilwicka, later Chojnacka; 24 February 1931 – 19 December 2020) was a Romanian-born Polish sprinter, hurdler, and long jumper. She was born in Goleni, Romania. She was a three-time Olympian (Helsinki 1952, Rome 1960 and Tokyo 1964). In three European Championships (1954 Bern, 1958 Stockholm, and 1962 Belgrade), she won three medals. Piątkowska died on 19 December 2020 at the age of 89.Historiska OS-svenskan död ==References== Category:1931 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Polish sprinters Category:Polish hurdlers Category:Polish long jumpers Category:Olympians for Poland
title: Maria Piątkowska
